sentences.english: You know a heart of gold won't take you all the way.
sentences.chinese: 你要知道一顆善良的心不會一直庇佑爲你披荊斬棘。

sentences.english: His safety is the physical manifestation of his belief in God’s protection.
sentences.chinese: 他的安全就是他堅信上帝庇佑的物理表現。

sentences.english: He looks forward to the harvest because he knows he's going to be blessed.
sentences.chinese: 他期待來年的豐收，因爲他知道他將獲得神的庇佑。

sentences.english: Chinese people expect the auspicious clouds to bring blessings and harmony.
sentences.chinese: 中國人也希望祥雲能夠帶來庇佑與和諧。

sentences.english: If you want God's blessing on your finances, you've got to be honest.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想上帝庇佑你的財產，你就必須保持誠實公正。

sentences.english: Nuclear weapons are a trap, not a gift.
sentences.chinese: 核武器是一個陷阱，而非庇佑。

sentences.english: The Afghan War was a blessing for our nuclear program.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗戰爭對我們的核項目是一種庇佑。

definition: asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
to help one another/to come to sb's help
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
flood of good fortune fills the heavens (idiom); a lucky sign
